metadata.title: CVE-2023-2163 on Ubuntu 16.04 FIPS Compliant (xenial) - medium
metadata.description:
Incorrect verifier pruning in BPF in Linux Kernel >=5.4 leads to unsafecode paths being incorrectly marked as safe, resulting in arbitraryread/write in kernel memory, lateral privilege escalation, and containerescape.

    Update Instructions:

    Run `sudo pro fix CVE-2023-2163` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
    by updating your system to the following package versions:

linux-image-4.4.0-1003-fips - 4.4.0-1098.105
linux-image-extra-4.4.0-1003-fips - 4.4.0-1098.105
linux-image-hmac-4.4.0-1003-fips - 4.4.0-1098.105
Available with Ubuntu Pro: https://ubuntu.com/pro

criterions.comment: linux: while related to the CVE in some way, a decision has been made to ignore this issue (note: 'end of standard support').
linux-hwe: while related to the CVE in some way, a decision has been made to ignore this issue (note: 'end of standard support').
